title.rendered: Perth vs Sydney, Qualifier, Australian T20 League 2022: Today’s Match Preview, Fantasy Cricket Tips

content.rendered:
We have opted for a fantasy cricket team based on the recent performances, overall impact, and credit points.

Probable XIs

Perth: Stephen Eskinazi, Cameron Bancroft, Aaron Hardie, Josh Inglis (wk), Ashton Turner (c), Nick Hobson, Cooper Connolly, Matthew Kelly, Andrew Tye, David Payne, Jason Behrendorff, Peter Hatzoglou

Sydney: Josh Philippe (wk), Steven Smith, Kurtis Patterson, Moises Henriques (c), Jordan Silk, Hayden Kerr, Daniel Christian, Ben Dwarshuis, Sean Abbott, Jackson Bird, Izharulhaq Naveed/Steve O’Keefe

Pitch Report

Venue: Perth Stadium, Perth

(Based on the last 3 games)

1st innings average score: 177

2nd innings average score: 193

Wickets per innings: 6

Type: A batting beauty

Wins

Batting 1st: 33%

Batting 2nd: 67%

Fantasy Tips of the Day

Aaron Hardie (263 runs) and Andrew Tye (24 wickets) are the highest run-scorer and wicket-taker respectively at the Perth Stadium in this season. Tye is also the top wicket-taker for Perth against Sydney.

In the T20s between these teams, Ashton Turner is the highest run-scorer. He has smashed 460 runs at a spectacular strike rate of 149.

Although Josh Philippe has been blowing hot and cold, his numbers against Perth are encouraging: 352 runs at 35. In fact, one of his two fifties this season came versus Perth.

In the last six games, Sean Abbott has sniped up four three-wicket hauls. He has been one of the safest power players this season.

In the last 3 games, Steven Smith was the captain twice and vice-captain once in the Ultimate Team.

Stephen Eskinazi made it to the Ultimate Team in 4 of the last 5 matches, scoring two fifties and a thirty.

In the last 3 games at the venue, as many as 43 sixes were plundered and 22 of 34 wickets belonged to pacers.
